item.title: Build your homepage using Blowfish and Hugo
item.author: info@dataingenio.com (Tama Francisquez)
item.description: Just one year ago, I created Blowfish, a Hugo theme crafted to build my unique vision for my personal homepage. I also decided to make it an open-source project. Fast-forward to today, and Blowfish has transformed into a thriving open-source project with over 600 stars on GitHub and a user base of hundreds. In this tutorial, I’ll show you how to get started and have your website running in a couple of minutes.

item.title: Static Feedback #4 — Creating the Blowfish Hugo Theme
item.author: info@dataingenio.com (Tama Francisquez)
item.description: Today I got the chance to sit down with David Large from CloudCannon to talk about open-source, Hugo, and my theme, Blowfish.

item.title: How I Created My Homepage (for free) Using Docker, Hugo, and Firebase
item.author: info@dataingenio.com (Tama Francisquez)
item.description: Currently, there are several solutions to build and host your personal website. I wanted to challenge myself to see if I could do it with the same set of features as some of the paid solutions out there and for free. Here are the results.
